titleStmt.title: Bede, De tabernaculo, De templo Salomonis

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De tabernaculo

msItem.incipit: Moyses in montem domini cum iosue ascendens.

msItem.rubric: Incipit expositio uenerabilis Bede presbiteri de tabernaculo. et uasis eius. ac uestibus sacerdotum.

msItem.incipit: Locuturi iuuante domino de figura tabernaculi
msItem.explicit: fol. 77va Omnes qui uiderint eos cognoscent illos⸵ quia isti sunt semen cui benedixit dominus.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber tertius De tabernaculo Testimonii beati bede presbiteri.

msItem.rubric: fol. 77ra Incipit prefatio uenerabilis Bede presbiteri in expositione De templo Salomonis.
msItem.incipit: Hortatur nos uas electionis et magister gentium ad lectionem diuinorum eloquiorum ueridica uoce contestans.
Quod edificatio tabernaculi et templi unam eandemque cristi ęcclesiam designet.
msItem.explicit: fol. 78vb De cardinibus ostiorum et prefectione.

msItem.rubric: Incipit espositio uenerabilis Bede presbiteri De templo Salomonis.
msItem.incipit: fol. 79ra Domus domini quam edificauit rex salomon
msItem.explicit: fol. 131vb Vna tamen benedictione sanctificata parauit⸵ quia nimirum una est domus patris non manufacta ęterna in cęlis. sed multę in ea mansiones ad recipiendos omnes timentes dominum ac diligentes. quos dominus benedicit pusillos cum maioribus;
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit expositio Bede presbiteri de templo Salomonis.

collation.signatures: Last page of each gathering numbered in ink, ·I· to ·XVI·.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in drypoint; pricked out outer edges of the page for frame and individual lines, 7 mm apart.

handDesc.handNote: Protogothic, with two scribes, one writing a more compressed version of the script.
Directions to the rubricator in a charter hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubricated headings and chapter numbers. Major divisions begin with a large decorated Arabesque initials: fol. 2ra (De tabernaculo, book 1), L with ascender extending into the margin, pastel blue with golden and green flourishes; fol. 22va (book 2), 6-line T descending into the lower margin, red with golden and green flourishes; fol. 50vb (book 3), 4-line P, golden with red, blue, and green flourishes; fol. 77va (De templo, prologue), 6-line H, blue with red, golden, and green flourishes; fol. 79ra (De templo text), 7-line D, green with red, golden, and blue flourishes. New chapters open with 2-line initials, red, blue, and golden; enlarged coloured capitals used to open first lines of texts and for first letters in list of chapters. Quotations indicated by S-shaped marks in the margin beside each line.

binding.p: Gothic, whittawed leather over oak boards, rebacked. Holes for a chain at the foot of the lower board. White and blue endbands.
binding.decoNote: On front cover, Beda (s. xiii?) and table of contents by John Prise.

history.origin: Written at Cirencester Abbey between 1149 and 1176. On fol. 1v, Liber sancte Marie De Cirencestr’. D’ Andree Abbatis secundi tempore scriptus per manus D’ Alexandri postmodum Cantoris et Radulfi de pulleham cuiusdam scriptoris D’ Adam de lamora tunc Cantore. Andrew was abbot from 1147 to 1176. Adam was preceded in office by Gilbert, who was still cantor in 1149: H.E. Salter, ed., Cartulary of Oseney Abbey, Oxford Historical Society 89–91, 97, 98, 101 (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1929–1936), 4:28–29.
history.acquisition: Appears in the list of the books of John Prise in the 1602 donation willed to Jesus College by his son Gregory Prise (1535–1600). Neil R. Ker, ‘Sir John Prise’, The Library, 5th ser., 10, no. 1 (March 1955): 1–24.

listBibl.bibl: Andrew G. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts c. 435–1600 in Oxford Libraries (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1984), no. 798 and pl. 58.
